note.p: The letter is dated to 21 June 1877, the Thursday before the letter was registered in the Chief Secretary's Department on 23 June 1877.

div.p:
I Iearn at the public works office, dear Mr Odgers, that as yet no communication in reference to the building vote for my Department has been received there from your office. This makes me anxious to ask you in time, whether I have yet to do anything further to secure the favorable consideration of my proposal to give me £1800 in the new financial year after the saving of the £900 on the votes of the present (or rather past) year.
See also M to J. MacPherson, 16 April 1877 (in this edition as 77-04-16a). MS annotation against this section: ' not here '.

Ferd. von Mueller.
MS annotation: 'It has been recd at P. Work I know'.
I enclose my card for the hon Gr. Berry.
